intro: Uvariastrum, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. The plants are characterized by their opposite, simple, and often elliptical leaves. They produce small, clustered flowers that are typically white or greenish-white, followed by berries that are edible in some species. Uvariastrum species are valued for their ornamental appeal and have traditional uses in medicine and cuisine.
